text: The voiceless velar stop is a type of consonant. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is `⟨k⟩`. The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by the "c" in care and the "k" in kiss. == Feeatures == See also: Voiced velar lateral stop == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning Abkhaz /ak̇halak̇h’ 'the city' Adyghe Shapsug /k′ėt 'chicken' Temirgoy /pskėn Ahtna gistaann 'six' Aleut 'cranberry bush' Arabic Modern Standard /kutib 'he wrote' Armenian Eastern / k'aġak'/k'aghak 'town' Assamese /kom 'less' Assyrian ܟܬܒ̣ܐ ] 'book' Basque 'cat' Bengali /kom 'less' Bulgarian /kak 'how' Catalan 'hearts' Chinese Cantonese / 'home' Hokkien 'song' Mandarin / 'high' Chuvash кукка [ku'kːɑ] 'mother's brother' Czech 'bone' Danish Standard 'goose' Dutch 'king' English kiss 'kiss' Esperanto 'tale' Estonian kõik 'all' Filipino 'lice' Finnish 'cake' French 'office' Georgian /kva 'stone' German 'cage' Greek 'monk' Gujarati /kaṃde 'onion' Hebrew 'money' Hiligaynon 'laugh' Hindustani / 'work' Hungarian 'then' Italian 'house' Japanese / 'handbag' Kagayanen 'spirit' Khmer / 'Cambodia' Korean 감자 / 'potato' Lakota kimímela 'butterfly' Luxembourgish 'goat' Macedonian кој 'who' Marathi 'armour' Malay 'leg' Nepali 'banana' Norwegian 'cake' Odia /kāma 'work' Pashto /kal 'year' Persian کارد/kārd [kɑrd] 'knife' Polish 'beech tree' Portuguese 'body' Punjabi /کر/kar 'do' RomanianDEX Online : 'when' Russian /korotkiy 'short' Serbo-Croatian / 'bone' Slovak 'bone' Spanish 'house' Swedish 'cow' Sylheti /kita 'what' Tamil கை/kai 'hand' Telugu కాకి/kāki 'crow' Thai /kị̀ 'chicken' Turkish 'ear' Ubykh кауар/kawar 'slat' Ukrainian /koleso 'wheel' Vietnamese 'orange' Welsh calon [kalɔn] 'heart' West Frisian 'calf' Yi / 'foolish' Zapotec Tilquiapan canza 'walking' ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * * Category:Consonants
title: Voiceless velar plosive
